quotes.quote: The thicker the skin, the happier the man. @LifeMathMoney
Folks are usually about as happy as they make their minds up to be. Abraham Lincoln
Doing what you were born to do… That’s the way to be happy. Agnes Martin
Don’t postpone joy until you have learned all of your lessons. Joy is your lesson. Alan Cohen
Only a life lived for others is a life worthwhile. Albert Einstein
Happiness? That’s nothing more than health and a poor memory. Albert Schweitzer
I don’t know what your destiny will be, but one thing I do know: the only ones among you who will be really happy are those who have sought and found how to serve. Albert Schweitzer
The constant happiness is curiosity. Alice Munro
Being happy is not the only happiness. Alice Walker
If you want to be happy, set a goal that commands your thoughts, liberates your energy, and inspires your hopes. Andrew Carnegie
Whoever is happy will make others happy. Anne Frank
People don’t notice whether it’s winter or summer when they’re happy. Anton Chekhov
Happiness depends upon ourselves. Aristotle
Happiness does not consist in pastimes and amusements but in virtuous activities. Aristotle
It is difficult to find happiness within oneself, but it is impossible to find it anywhere else. Arthur Schopenhauer
The most important thing is to enjoy your life – to be happy – it’s all that matters. Audrey Hepburn
Indeed, man wishes to be happy even when he so lives as to make happiness impossible. Augustine of Hippo
Learn to value yourself, which means: fight for your happiness. Ayn Rand
Happiness is that state of consciousness which proceeds from the achievement of one’s values. Ayn Rand
If you aren’t grateful for what you already have, what makes you think you would be happy with more. Roy T. Bennett
Blessed are those who can give without remembering and take without forgetting. Bernard Meltzer
To be without some of the things you want is an indispensable part of happiness. Bertrand Russell
Enjoyment is just the sound of being centered. Bhagwan Shree Rajneesh
Thousands of candles can be lit from a single candle, and the life of the candle will not be shortened. Happiness never decreases by being shared. Buddha
In our lives, change is unavoidable, loss is unavoidable. In the adaptability and ease with which we experience change, lies our happiness and freedom. Buddha
The secret of happiness is to admire without desiring. Carl Sandburg
The secret of happiness is freedom, the secret of freedom is courage. Carrie Jones
Happiness is a gift and the trick is not to expect it, but to delight in it when it comes. Charles Dickens
It is not how much we have, but how much we enjoy, that makes happiness. Charles Spurgeon
Tension is who you think you should be, relaxation is who you are. Chinese proverb
The only way to find true happiness is to risk being completely cut open. Chuck Palahniuk
What a wonderful life I’ve had! I only wish I’d realized it sooner. Colette
Be happy. It’s one way of being wise. Colette
Life is really simple, but we insist on making it complicated. Confucius
If you want others to be happy, practice compassion. If you want to be happy, practice compassion. Dalai Lama
Happiness is not something ready made. It comes from your own actions. Dalai Lama
success quotes is getting what you want. Happiness is wanting what you get. Dale Carnegie

Today is life – the only life you are sure of. Make the most of today. Get interested in something. Shake yourself awake. Develop a hobby. Let the winds of enthusiasm sweep through you. Live today with gusto. Dale Carnegie
People are unhappy when they get something too easily. You have to sweat – that’s the only moral they know. Dany Laferrière
I’m happy. Which often looks like crazy. David Henry Hwang
Happiness does not lead to gratitude. Gratitude leads to happiness. David Steindl-Rast
Don’t take life too seriously. You’ll never get out of it alive. Elbert Hubbard
Happiness in intelligent people is the rarest thing I know. Ernest Hemingway
Doing what you like is freedom. Liking what you do is happiness. Frank Tyger
There can be no happiness if the things we believe in are different from the things we do. Freya Stark
The advantage of a bad memory is that one enjoys several times the same good things for the first time. Friedrich Nietzsche
What is happiness? The feeling that power is growing, that resistance is overcome. Friedrich Nietzsche
There is only one happiness in this life, to love and be loved. George Sand
Now and then it’s good to pause in our pursuit of happiness and just be happy. Guillaume Apollinaire
Happiness is a direction, not a place. Sydney J. Harris
True happiness is not attained through self-gratification, but through fidelity to a worthy purpose. Helen Keller
When one door of happiness closes, another opens, but often we look so long at the closed door that we do not see the one that has been opened for us. Helen Keller
You can only have bliss if you don’t chase it. Henepola Gunaratana
Joy is more divine than sorrow; for joy is bread, and sorrow is medicine. Henry Ward Beecher
All happiness depends on courage and work. Honoré de Balzac
On the whole, the happiest people seem to be those who have no particular cause for being happy except that they are so. William R. Inge
The foolish man seeks happiness in the distance, the wise grows it under his feet. James Oppenheim
There is great happiness in not wanting, in not being something, in not going somewhere. Jiddu Krishnamurti
If you don’t design your own life plan, chances are you’ll fall into someone else’s plan. And guess what they have planned for you? Not much. Jim Rohn
There are two ways to be happy: improve your reality, or lower your expectations. Jodi Picoult
Ask yourself whether you are happy and you cease to be so. John Stuart Mill
Three grand essentials to happiness in this life are something to do, something to love, and something to hope for. Joseph Addison
True happiness arises, in the first place, from the enjoyment of one’s self. Joseph Addison
Everything is a gift of the universe – even joy, anger, jealously, frustration, or separateness. Everything is perfect either for our growth or our enjoyment. Ken Keyes Jr
I have only two kinds of days: happy and hysterically happy. Allen J. Lefferdink
If you want to be happy, be. Leo Tolstoy

A quiet secluded life in the country, with the possibility of being useful to people to whom it is easy to do good, and who are not accustomed to have it done to them; then work which one hopes may be of some use; then rest, nature, books, music, love for one’s neighbor — such is my idea of happiness. Leo Tolstoy
Don’t let your happiness depend on something you may lose. C. S. Lewis
Life is 10 percent what happens to you and 90 percent how you respond to it. Lou Holtz
Don’t cry because it’s over, smile because it happened. Ludwig Jacobowski
Usefulness is happiness, and… all other things are but incidental. Lydia Maria Child, The American Frugal Housewife
Happiness is when what you think, what you say, and what you do are in harmony. Mahatma Gandhi
He who lives in harmony with himself lives in harmony with the universe. Marcus Aurelius
The best way to cheer yourself is to try to cheer someone else up. Mark Twain
Time you enjoy wasting is not wasted time. Marthe Troly-Curtin
Live with intention. Walk to the edge. Listen hard. Practice wellness. Play with abandon. Laugh. Choose with no regret. Do what you love. Live as if this is all there is. Mary Anne Roadacher-Hershey
My mission in life is not merely to survive, but to thrive; and to do so with some passion, some compassion, some humor, and some style. Maya Angelou
It’s been my experience that you can nearly always enjoy things if you make up your mind firmly that you will. L. M. Montgomery
If you find happiness, people may be jealous. Be happy anyway. Mother Teresa
Happiness in this world, when it comes, comes incidentally. Make it the object of pursuit, and it leads us a wild-goose chase, and is never attained. Nathaniel Hawthorne
Happiness comes from peace. Peace comes from indifference. Naval Ravikant
Happiness is a state where nothing is missing. Naval Ravikant
That’s your unlimited desires that are clouding your peace, your happiness. Naval Ravikant
Not wanting something is as good as having it. Naval Ravikant
With my desire to improve everything, I destroy the moment. Naval Ravikant
Happiness is a choice and a skill and you can dedicate yourself to learning that skill and making that choice. Naval Ravikant

School, politics, sports, and games train us to compete against others. True rewards – wealth, knowledge, love, fitness, and equanimity – come from ignoring others and improving ourselves. Naval Ravikant
Happiness is the default state. It’s what’s there when you remove the sense that something is missing in life. Naval Ravikant
When neither their property nor their honor is touched, the majority of men live content. Niccolo Machiavelli
The biggest adventure you can take is to live the life of your dreams. Oprah Winfrey
For every minute you are angry you lose sixty seconds of happiness. Ralph Waldo Emerson
It’s the moments that I stopped just to be, rather than do, that have given me true happiness. Richard Branson
If we would just slow down, happiness would catch up to us. Richard Carlson
One of the keys to happiness is a bad memory. Rita Mae Brown
Sometimes we don’t find the thing that will make us happy because we can’t give up the thing that was supposed to. Robert Brault
To be happy, you must fancy that everything you have is a gift, and you the chosen, though you worked your tail off for every bit of it. Robert Brault
Happiness makes up in height for what it lacks in length. Robert Frost
Happiness lies in the joy of achievement and the thrill of creative effort. Franklin D. Roosevelt
It is more fitting for a man to laugh at life than to lament over it. Seneca
I am very happy because I have conquered myself and not the world. I am very happy because I have loved the world and not myself. Sri Chinmoy
Enjoy it. Because it’s happening. Stephen Chbosky
Cry. Forgive. Learn. Move on. Let your tears water the seeds of your future happiness. Steve Maraboli
The greatest secret to happiness and peace is letting every life situation be what it is, instead of what you think it should be. Then, make the very best of it. Thibaut

Our greatest happiness does not depend on the condition of life in which chance has placed us, but is always the result of a good conscience, good health, occupation, and freedom in all just pursuits. Thomas Jefferson
Boredom is the feeling that everything is a waste of time…serenity, that nothing is. Thomas Szasz
Happiness is inversely correlated with desire. Unknown
Happiness is acceptance. Unknown
A truly happy person is one who can enjoy the scenery while on a detour. Unknown
Happiness, not in another place but this place…not for another hour, but this hour. Walt Whitman
What we think determines what happens to us, so if we want to change our lives, we need to stretch our minds. Wayne Dyer
Happiness is a function of accepting what is. Werner Erhard
Happiness is an inside job. William Arthur Ward
Plenty of people miss their share of happiness, not because they never found it, but because they didn’t stop to enjoy it. William Feather
We don’t laugh because we’re happy – we’re happy because we laugh. William James
The greatest happiness you can have is knowing that you do not necessarily require happiness. William Saroyan
Nobody can be uncheered with a balloon. Winnie the Pooh
You are completely in control of your own happiness, and you have no control over the happiness of others. Naval Ravikant (twitter.com)
Pleasure is very seldom found where it is sought. Our brightest blazes are commonly kindled by unexpected sparks. Samuel Johnson
There is no way to happiness — happiness is the way. Thich Nhat Hanh (notable-quotes.com)
Difficult roads often leads to beautiful destinations.
It’s the little things in life.
Happiness is not out there, it’s in you.
There is no happiness; there are only moments of happiness.
You can’t buy happiness but you can buy ice cream. And that’s kind of the same thing.
There is some kind of a sweet innocence in being human- in not having to be just happy or just sad- in the nature of being able to be both broken and whole, at the same time. C. JoyBell C.
And I urge you to please notice when you are happy, and exclaim or murmur or think at some point, ‘If this isn’t nice, I don’t know what is. ’ Kurt Vonnegut
Love is a better teacher than duty. Albert Einstein

In a true partnership, the kind worth striving for, the kind worth insisting on, and even, frankly, worth divorcing over, both people try to give as much or even a little more than they get. ‘Deserves’ is not the point. And ‘owes’ is certainly not the point. The point is to make the other person as happy as we can, because their happiness adds to ours. The point is – in the right hands, everything that you give, you get. Amy Bloom
It is better to be hated for what you are than loved for what you are not. Andre Gide
Love is boundary-less. Angel Haze
Him that I love, I wish to be free – even from me. Anne Morrow Lindbergh
Love does not consist of gazing at each other, but in looking together in the same direction. Antoine de Saint-Exupery
Love is composed of a single soul inhabiting two bodies. Aristotle
We must love one another or die. W. H. Auden
Each time you love, love as deeply as if it were forever – only, nothing is eternal. Audre Lorde
Better to have loved and lost, than to have never loved at all. Augustine of Hippo
Love is the beauty of the soul. Augustine of Hippo
Love’s greatest gift is its ability to make everything it touches sacred. Barbara De Angelis
You never lose by loving. You always lose by holding back. Barbara De Angelis
Love is a choice you make from moment to moment. Barbara De Angelis
Love and kindness are never wasted. They always make a difference. They bless the one who receives them, and they bless you, the giver. Barbara De Angelis
Love does not die easily. It is a living thing. James D. Bryden
Tell me who admires and loves you, and I will tell you who you are. Charles Augustin Sainte-Beuve
A loving heart is the truest wisdom. Charles Dickens
Love is sharing your popcorn. Charles Schultz (Charlie Brown)

A source of trouble is our unruly minds. We can counter that by developing a warm heart. We need to effect an inner transformation, to understand that love and affection are a real source of joy. Dalai Lama
We need not think alike to love alike. David Ferenc
You call it madness, but I call it love. Don Byas
The love we give away is the only love we keep. Elbert Hubbard
The giving of love is an education in itself. Eleanor Roosevelt
Whoso loves, believes the impossible. Elizabeth Barrett Browning
He is not a lover who does not love forever. Euripides
Love is the expansion of two natures in such fashion that each include the other, each is enriched by the other. Felix Adler
I know of no greater happiness than to be with you all the time, without interruption, without end. Franz Kafka
Every thing that you love, you will eventually lose, but in the end, love will return in a different form. Franz Kafka
Love is blind; friendship closes its eyes. Friedrich Nietzsche
To be trusted is a greater compliment than to be loved. George MacDonald

Have you ever been at sea in a dense fog, when it seemed as if a tangible white darkness shut you in and the great ship, tense and anxious, groped her way toward the shore with plummet and sounding-line, and you waited with beating heart for something to happen? Helen Keller
I was like that ship before my education began, only I was without compass or sounding line, and no way of knowing how near the harbor was. Helen Keller
‘Light! Give me light!’ was the wordless cry of my soul, and the light of love shone on me in that very hour. Helen Keller
Love must be as much a light as it is a flame. Henry David Thoreau
There is no remedy for love but to love more. Henry David Thoreau
Don’t ask yourself what the world needs, ask yourself what makes you come alive. And then go and do that. Because what the world needs is people who have come alive. Howard Washington Thurman

Love her, love her, love her! If she favours you, love her. If she wounds you, love her. If she tears your heart to pieces – and as it gets older and stronger, it will tear deeper – love her, love her, love her! Charles Dickens
If you don’t love yourself who will? Naval Ravikant
We can only learn to love by loving. Iris Murdoch
In the end we discover that to love and let go can be the same thing. Jack Kornfield
Love does not begin and end the way we seem to think it does. Love is a battle, love is a war; love is a growing up. James Baldwin
Love is the strange bewilderment which overtakes one person on account of another person. James Thurber
To love is to burn, to be on fire. Jane Austen
Age does not protect you from love, but love to some extent protects you from age. Jeanne Moreau
When the power of love overcomes the love of power the world will know peace. Jimi Hendrix
If someone thinks that love and peace is a cliche that must have been left behind in the Sixties, that’s his problem. Love and peace are eternal. John Lennon
Love doesn’t make the world go ’round. Love is what makes the ride worthwhile. Franklin P. Jones

This day, I vow to myself to love myself, to treat myself as someone I love truly and deeply – in my thoughts, my actions, the choices I make, the experiences I have, each moment I am conscious, I make the decision “I love myself”. Kamal Ravikant
Love must be learned, and learned again and again; there is no end to it. Katherine Anne Porter
Kindness in words creates confidence. Kindness in thinking creates profundity. Kindness in giving creates love. Lao Tzu
Being deeply loved by someone gives you strength, while loving someone deeply gives you courage. Lao Tzu
There is always something left to love. And if you ain’t learned that, you ain’t learned nothing. Lorraine Hansberry
In matters of the heart, nothing is true except the improbable. Madame de Stael
Where there is love there is life. Mahatma Gandhi

In reality, in love there is a permanent suffering which joy neutralizes, renders virtual, delays, but which can at any moment become what it would have become long earlier if one had not obtained what one wanted, atrocious. Marcel Proust
Life is the first gift, love is the second, and understanding the third. Marge Piercy

I’m selfish, impatient and a little insecure. I make mistakes, I am out of control and at times hard to handle. But if you can’t handle me at my worst, then you sure as hell don’t deserve me at my best. Marilyn Monroe
I believe that unarmed truth and unconditional love will have the final word in reality. This is why right, temporarily defeated, is stronger than evil triumphant. Martin Luther King Jr
Love yourself. Then forget it. Then, love the world. Mary Oliver
Never make someone a priority when all you are to them is an option. Maya Angelou
You make me want to be a better man. Melvin Udall (As Good As It Gets)
Love is often the fruit of marriage. Molière
Even better than being loved is being in love. Naval Ravikant
We love because it’s the only true adventure. Nikki Giovanni
Love is the greatest refreshment in life. Pablo Picasso
All you need is love. Paul McCartney
The first duty of love is to listen. Paul Tillich
You look amazing. I’m so lucky. Prince Harry
You’ve gotta dance like there’s nobody watching, love like you’ll never be hurt, sing like there’s nobody listening, and live like it’s heaven on earth. William W. Purkey
Givers need to set limits because takers rarely do. Rachel Wolchin
We must be our own before we can be another’s. Ralph Waldo Emerson
True love stories never have endings. Richard Bach
I love you, not only for what you are, but for what I am when I am with you. Roy Croft
Let yourself be silently drawn by the stronger pull of what you really love. Rumi

You learn to speak by speaking, to study by studying, to run by running, to work by working; and just so, you learn to love by loving. All those who think to learn in any other way deceive themselves. Saint Francis de Sales
Love isn’t finding a perfect person. It’s seeing an imperfect person perfectly. Sam Keen
It doesn’t matter if the guy is perfect or the girl is perfect, as long as they are perfect for each other. Sean (Good Will Hunting)
You know you’re in love when you can’t fall asleep because reality is finally better than your dreams. Dr. Seuss

Love is the product of how you respond … Love is showing your partner they’re safe, you’ll catch them if they fall, and you’ll drop everything if they need you. Love is unconditional. Love doesn’t keep score. Shane Parrish
Love as a power can go anywhere. It isn’t sentimental. It doesn’t have to be pretty, yet it doesn’t deny pain. Sharon Salzberg
Attention is the rarest and purest form of generosity. Simone Weil
By all means marry. If you get a good wife, you’ll be happy. If you get a bad one, you’ll become a philosopher. Socrates
One word frees us of all the weight and pain of life: that word is love. Sophocles
Love does not alter the beloved, it alters itself. Soren Kierkegaard
There is a love, that blazes up and is forgotten; there is a love until death. Søren Kierkegaard
I wish I had done everything on Earth with you. The Great Gatsby
To love is, first of all, to accept ourselves as we actually are. Thich Nhat Hanh
Patience is the mark of true love. If you truly love someone, you will be more patient with that person. Thich Nhat Hanh
I would rather spend one lifetime with you, than face all the ages of this world alone. J.R.R. Tolkien
Only one life, that soon is past. Only what’s done with love will last. Unknown
Just in case you have forgotten today: You matter. You are loved. You are worthy. You are magical. Unknown
Be with someone who is proud to have you. Unknown
No one is you and that is your super power. Unknown
You are enough. Unknown
The supreme happiness of life is the conviction that we are loved. Victor Hugo
The more I think it over, the more I feel that there is nothing more truly artistic than to love people. Vincent van Gogh
Love is never lost. If not reciprocated, it will flow back and soften and purify the heart. Washington Irving
Where there is great love, there are always miracles. Willa Cather

Flatter me, and I may not believe you. Criticize me, and I may not like you. Ignore me, and I may not forgive you. Encourage me, and I will not forget you. Love me and I may be forced to love you. William Arthur Ward
Love all, trust a few. William Shakespeare
Neither a lofty degree of intelligence nor imagination nor both together go to the making of genius. Love, love, love, that is the soul of genius. Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart
Most college degrees are certificates of gullibility. @LifeMathMoney

The ultimate test of knowledge is self-transformation. Knowledge is of use only if it brings a profound change in yourself. Make sure that your knowledge is qualitative, not just quantitative. The quality of understanding is important, not the quantity of information. @TheAncientSage

Your problem is not a lack of knowledge; you already have more of it than 90% of people will ever have. The problem is a lack of implementation. Once you’ve acquired a certain amount of knowledge, adding more to it is less important than putting your current knowledge to work. @TheAncientSage

Our tragedy is that we read too much and reflect too little. Anything worth reading is worth deep contemplation. Knowledge without absorption leaves no lasting mark on us and is little different from a passing amusement. @TheAncientSage

Understanding is far more important than knowledge. Knowledge is quantitative. It is information. It remains peripheral. Understanding is qualitative. It penetrates your heart and permeates your being. Knowledge boosts the ego but only understanding brings transformation. @TheAncientSage

If you’re broke and tell people money is not important, they won’t listen to you. If you’re ignorant and say knowledge is vanity, no one believes you. If you preach stoicism but never faced any difficulties, your sermon is futile. Let your message grow out of your own experience. @TheAncientSage
Wise people say less than they know. Fools say everything they know and many things they don’t. @TheStoicEmperor

Almost all Americans own a smartphone or a computer. Each device contains the library of Alexandria. The sum total of all world knowledge. You can learn anything. Why don’t you? Too busy tracking social status. Too enthralled by imagery your evolution can’t resist. @TheStoicEmperor

A great book can transmit years of wisdom in a few afternoons. Each sentence conveys meaning with precision and economy. A great book is a patient teacher and a deathless companion. A man with a good library has a thousand good mentors. @TheStoicEmperor
That which we desire lies across an ocean of hard won knowledge. @TheStoicEmperor
A society of narrowly developed specialists is a society expert in seeing trees but not forests. @TheStoicEmperor

A miseducation is much more dangerous than no education. An uneducated person has common sense born of pattern recognition. A miseducated person has traded good sense for bad theories. @TheStoicEmperor

Never stop fighting until you arrive at your destined place – that is, the unique you. Have an aim in life, continuously acquire knowledge, work hard, and have perseverance to realise the great life. A. P. J. Abdul Kalam
Time, as it grows old, teaches all things. Aeschylus
Wisdom is not a product of schooling but of the lifelong attempt to acquire it. Albert Einstein
Any fool can know. The point is to understand. Albert Einstein
The true sign of intelligence is not knowledge but imagination. Albert Einstein
Imagination is more important than knowledge. Knowledge is limited. Imagination encircles the world. Albert Einstein
A little learning is a dangerous thing; drink deep, or taste not the Pierian spring: there shallow draughts intoxicate the brain, and drinking largely sobers us again. Alexander Pope
The possession of knowledge does not kill the sense of wonder and mystery. There is always more mystery. Anais Nin
Knowledge is of no value unless you put it into practice. Anton Chekhov
Are you focused enough on the same thing to build cumulative knowledge or are you too spread out? Shane Parrish
An investment in knowledge always pays the best interest. Benjamin Franklin
The trouble with the world is that the stupid are cocksure and the intelligent are full of doubt. Bertrand Russell
The greatest obstacle to discovery is not ignorance – it is the illusion of knowledge. Daniel J. Boorstin
Knowledge will give you power, but character respect. Bruce Lee
Real knowledge breeds “body feel” and personal expression; surface knowledge breeds mechanical conditioning and imposing limitation and squelches creativity. Bruce Lee
The greatest impurity is ignorance. Free yourself from it. Be pure. Buddhist proverb
The suppression of uncomfortable ideas may be common in religion or in politics, but it is not the path to knowledge and there is no place for it in the endeavor of science. Carl Sagan
The end of all knowledge should be service to others. Cesar Chavez
The best thing a human being can do is to help another human being know more. Charlie Munger
Knowing what you don’t know is more useful than being brilliant. Charlie Munger
Spend each day trying to be a little wiser than you were when you woke up. Charlie Munger
I try to get rid of people who always confidently answer questions about which they don’t have any real knowledge. Charlie Munger
Acknowledging what you don’t know is the dawning of wisdom. Charlie Munger
Real knowledge is to know the extent of one’s ignorance. Confucius
Share your knowledge. It’s a way to achieve immortality. Dalai Lama
The value of knowledge depends on what else you know. David Perell
If you think that knowledge alone is power, remember: people still smoke and drink soda. Ed Latimore
The universe is full of magical things, patiently waiting for our wits to grow sharper. Eden Phillpotts
It is impossible for a man to learn what he thinks he already knows. Epictetus
Knowledge is power. Francis Bacon
No thief, however skillful, can rob one of knowledge, and that is why knowledge is the best and safest treasure to acquire. L. Frank Baum
The beginning of knowledge is the discovery of something we do not understand. Frank Herbert
Beware of false knowledge; it is more dangerous than ignorance. George Bernard Shaw
Knowledge without wisdom is like water in the sand. Guinean proverb
If money is your hope for independence, you will never have it. The only real security that a man can have in this world is a reserve of knowledge, experience and ability. Henry Ford
Virtue is an angel, but she is a blind one, and must ask Knowledge to show her the pathway that leads to her goal. Horace Mann
Write what you know. That should leave you with a lot of free time. Howard Nemerov
I had to deny knowledge in order to make room for faith. Immanuel Kant
All our knowledge begins with the senses, proceeds then to the understanding, and ends with reason. There is nothing higher than reason. Immanuel Kant
The saddest aspect of life right now is that science gathers knowledge faster than society gathers wisdom. Isaac Asimov
Knowledge has a beginning but no end. Geeta S. Iyengar
We do not need more knowledge but more wisdom. Wisdom comes from our own attention. Jack Kornfield
Knowledge is an unending adventure at the edge of uncertainty. Jacob Bronowski
The advancement and diffusion of knowledge is the only guardian of true liberty. James Madison
Timeless knowledge prepares you for a changing world. James Pierce
One is never afraid of the unknown; one is afraid of the known coming to and end. Jiddu Krishnamurti
You can only be afraid of what you think you know. Jiddu Krishnamurti
Knowledge is an addiction, as drink; knowledge does not bring understanding. Knowledge can be taught, but not wisdom; there must be freedom from knowledge for the coming of wisdom. Jiddu Krishnamurti

Information, the knowledge of facts, though ever increasing, is by its very nature limited. Wisdom is infinite, it includes knowledge and the way of action; but we take hold of a branch and think it is the whole tree. Through the knowledge of the part, we can never realize the joy of the whole. Intellect can never lead to the whole, for it is only a segment, a part. Jiddu Krishnamurti
The more you know, the less you need to say. Jim Rohn
Knowledge speaks, but wisdom listens. Jimi Hendrix
The improvement of understanding is for two ends: first, our own increase of knowledge; secondly, to enable us to deliver that knowledge to others. John Locke

Information – so abundant it’s worth practically nothing. Knowledge – scarce enough to be worth $, price determined by supply and demand, distribution follows a bell curve. Insight – So rare it could be worth a fortune, distribution is fat-tailed and the Black Swan rules. Johnny Uzan
Beware of the man who works hard to learn something, learns it, and finds himself no wiser than before. Kurt Vonnegut
Knowledge is rooted in all things — the world is a library. Lakota proverb
Know that you don’t know. That is superior. Lao Tzu
To attain knowledge, add things every day. To attain wisdom, remove things every day. Lao Tzu
To know that you do not know is the best. To think you know when you do not is a disease. Recognizing this disease as a disease is to be free of it. Lao Tzu
The more you know the less you understand. Lao Tzu (Tao Te Ching)
The desire of knowledge, like the thirst of riches, increases ever with the acquisition of it. Laurence Sterne

The fact that I can plant a seed and it becomes a flower, share a bit of knowledge and it becomes another’s, smile at someone and receive a smile in return, are to me continual spiritual exercises. Leo Buscaglia

The most difficult subjects can be explained to the most slow-witted man if he has not informed any idea of them already; but the simplest thing cannot be made clear to the most intelligent man if he is firmly persuaded that he knows already, without a shadow of doubt, what is laid before him. Leo Tolstoy
I have been impressed with the urgency of doing. Knowing is not enough; we must apply. Being willing is not enough; we must do. Leonardo da Vinci
Wisdom is the daughter of experience. Leonardo da Vinci
Where there is shouting, there is no true knowledge. Leonardo da Vinci
Better to understand a little than do misunderstand a lot. Lord Chesterfield
The dumbest people I know are those who know it all. Malcolm Forbes
This presumption that you possess knowledge of any use has to be dropped before you approach philosophy – just as if we were enrolling in a school of music or mathematics. Marcus Aurelius
Today a reader, tomorrow a leader. Margaret Fuller
To acquire knowledge, one must study; but to acquire wisdom, one must observe. Marilyn Vos Savant
If you don’t read the newspaper, you are uninformed; if you do read the newspaper, you are misinformed. Mark Twain
I was gratified to be able to answer promptly, and I did. I said I didn’t know. Mark Twain
Knowledge is a process of piling up facts; wisdom lies in their simplification. Martin Luther King Jr
I did then what I knew how to do. Now that I know better, I do better. Maya Angelou
If your goal is lasting insight, consuming news that will be irrelevant next week is a bad strategy. Michael
In an age of information abundance, the only things that really need to be taught are those that are counterintuitive. Michael
We can be knowledgeable with other men’s knowledge, but we cannot be wise with other men’s wisdom. Michel de Montaigne
Knowledge is knowing a tomato is a fruit; wisdom is not putting it in a fruit salad. Miles Kington
Real knowledge is intrinsic and it’s built from the ground up. Naval Ravikant
Knowledge is a skyscraper. You can take a shortcut with a fragile foundation of memorization, or build slowly upon a steel frame of understanding. Naval Ravikant
I know just enough to know how little we know. Naval Ravikant
Knowledge is useful when applied, but over-accumulated for its own sake is a burden. Naval Ravikant
Diversification is a hedge against a lack of knowledge. Naval Ravikant
Now we have the Internet, which is the greatest weapon of knowledge ever created, completely interconnected. Naval Ravikant

School, politics, sports, and games train us to compete against others. True rewards – wealth, knowledge, love, fitness, and equanimity – come from ignoring others and improving ourselves. Naval Ravikant
The overeducated are worse off than the undereducated, having traded common sense for the illusion of knowledge. Naval Ravikant

Knowledge is either from direct experience or from verifiable, falsifiable science. There is knowledge that is transmitted but not verifiable / falsifiable, and this knowledge is indistinguishable from that which is false. Naval Ravikant
For me, I am driven by two main philosophies: know more today about the world than I knew yesterday and lessen the suffering of others. You’d be surprised how far that gets you. Neil deGrasse Tyson
To know that we know what we know, and to know that we do not know what we do not know, that is true knowledge. Nicolaus Copernicus
Nothing that is worth knowing can be taught. Oscar Wilde
Knowledge if not digested does not give nutrition, only adds weight. Osho
Knowledge without transformation is not wisdom. Paulo Coelho
Doubt is wisdom. People are dangerous when they are certain that their cause is just and their facts are right. Paulo Coelho
It is nothing for one to know something unless another knows you know it. Persian proverb
The learning and knowledge that we have is, at the most, but little compared with that of which we are ignorant. Plato
The true lover of knowledge naturally strives for truth, and is not content with common opinion, but soars with undimmed and unwearied passion till he grasps the essential nature of things. Plato
And what, Socrates, is the food of the soul? Surely, I said, knowledge is the food of the soul. Plato
Human behavior flows from three main sources: desire, emotion, and knowledge. Plato
Knowledge has three degrees – opinion, science, illumination. The means or instrument of the first is sense; of the second, dialectic; of the third, intuition. Plotinus
If facts are the seeds that later produce knowledge and wisdom, then the emotions and the impressions of the senses are the fertile soil in which the seeds must grow. Rachel Carson
There is no knowledge that is not power. Ralph Waldo Emerson
Information is just bits of data. Knowledge is putting them together. Wisdom is transcending them. Ram Dass
The only thing that I know, is that I know nothing. René Descartes

I believe that imagination is stronger than knowledge – myth is more potent than history – dreams are more powerful than facts – hope always triumphs over experience – laughter is the cure for grief – love is stronger than death. Robert Fulghum
The future belongs to those who learn more skills and combine them in creative ways. Robert Greene
Take small bites. Before people realize it, you have accumulated an empire. Robert Greene
Learn to use the knowledge of the past and you will look like a genius, even when you are really just a clever borrower. Robert Greene
Do anything to break up your normal train of thinking and your sense that you already know the truth. Robert Greene
Constantly remind yourself of how little you truly know, and of how mysterious the world remains. Robert Greene
Everything we know has an expiration date. Samuel Arbesman
Wisdom > knowledge > information > data. Shane Parrish
Knowledge, like milk, has an expiry date. Shane Parrish
Knowledge is cumulative when you focus on things that change slowly. Shane Parrish
As we move forward we must remember that despite our quest, the shores of our ignorance grow as the Island of Knowledge grows. Shane Parrish
The larger the island of knowledge, the longer the shoreline of wonder. Ralph W. Sockman
The only true wisdom is in knowing you know nothing. Socrates
I am a part of everything that I have read. Theodore Roosevelt
Better to know how to know than to be taught what to know. Thibaut
The more you possess the more you are possessed. Thibaut

They will call you lost for not following the same route as others. They will call you a geek for being a knowledge-seeker. They will call you ugly for not looking like celebrities. They will call you dumb for not being an academic. Thibaut
Humility will teach you knowledge, arrogance will teach you ignorance. If you think you know it all, you have learned nothing. Thibaut (@kpaxs)
A loving heart is the beginning of all knowledge. Thomas Carlyle
Zeal without knowledge is the sister of folly. Unknown
These days people seek knowledge, not wisdom. Knowledge is of the past, wisdom is of the future. Vernon Cooper
The more I read, the more I acquire, the more certain I am that I know nothing. Voltaire
The best investment you can make, is an investment in yourself… The more you learn, the more you’ll earn. Warren Buffett
Risk comes from not knowing what you’re doing. Warren Buffett
If book knowledge made great investors, than the librarians would all be rich. Warren Buffett
Knowledge is power but only wisdom is liberty. Will Durant
Knowledge is proud that he has learn’d so much; Wisdom is humble that he knows no more. William Cowper
The art of being wise is the art of knowing what to overlook. William James
Ignorance is the curse of God; knowledge is the wing wherewith we fly to heaven. William Shakespeare
When an ordinary man attains knowledge, he is a sage; when a sage attains understanding, he is an ordinary man. Zen proverb
Great knowledge is universal. Small knowledge is limited. Great words are inspiring. Small words are chatter. Zhuangzi

response.message: Topic meaning of life not found
Topic personal growth and self-improvement not found
